title: What plot twist happened with your crush? - Quora

response.answer_text: She was a junior and had a boyfriend oof. She was in my Spanish class. Latina too. Even though she didn’t know any Spanish, I still liked her for her thick ass, big *you-know-whats*, and…. I don’t know- other things, but I can’t think right now. Despite looking the way she did, I assumed she had no boyfriend. This was because I thought I knew that she was a Freshman. I mean, thin about it. I’ve never seen her before, I thought I recognized her from middle school, I knew for sure she wasn’t in my grade (I know everyone in my grade), and she was good friends with this other Freshman girl (one I had a crush on before, but that doesn’t matter here). Her name was Anastasia (legit real name cuz no one gonna go looking her up, hopefully). The story goes….. The first day I saw her in Spanish class, I was thinking, “Oh, shiii! Damn.” Then I somehow knew she knew no Spanish. I knew she was Latina because her name was pronounced Ah-nn-ah. Now, I remembered something a friend said to me about my sixth grade crush and why she dated a seventh grader: “The girls just like older guys. That simple.” From a friend because I never learned anything from my dad. Unless you count how to fix cars, phones, computers, and a bunch of other things to do with technology (he’s an engineer), oh, and math, which I hate. I never learned anything from him about puberty is what I mean. I got information from my friends, porn, or gym class. When he tried to give me the talk once, I just sat there, and he could see I was uncomfortable, as was he, and that I knew everything. Back to the story. I’m good at Spanish. I taught myself some last year, but I had to take Spanish I because I never took any Spanish in school, only French. I offered help to the whole class, as a “trap” for her. None of the students, not even her, have asked me for help yet. Don’t worry, as finals come, they’ll crawl to me. I don’t have a crush on her anymore, but here’s what happened: Class Color Day for the pep-rally: We all wore our class colors for the pep-rally. I wore white because I was a Sophomore. All the Freshman wear yellow. Juniors- red; Seniors- blue. So…. We all here at school. Spanish class, first class of the day. All yellow and white in the class. Anna comes in wearing red, so I tease her, saying, “Wrong color, Anna! Where’s your yellow?” Anna: Yellow is an ugly color. I thought she was being a rebel. Which I would have liked, but I still went on to say, “But you’re a Freshman.” Anna: I’m a Junior! Wow, to think. I teased her to start conversation, and said she was a Freshman to keep up the conversation. Then it all abruptly stopped because I assumed. Oh, another thing my dad taught me. Assume= Ass u+me. So, I spent the next couple weeks sending her her own homecoming pictures with the Freshmen, saying, :This is why I thought you were a Freshman lmao” That didn’t turn me off though. One other night, I’m friends’ house. I do karate and jujitsu with them, and we go over there almost every Friday night after class. One of them, the boy (go figure), Naveen, just plays Call of Duty because he only talks to me at karate, apparently. My sister and I go up to hang out with Nisa, the girl. We just talk about whatever because board games bore us. We tried. We tried playing truth or dare; that didn’t last long because we couldn’t think of not-dirty-things for dares without annoying the parents with our clean dares. Nisa and I decided to call random people on our phones cuz why not. I told Nisa who she could call because there’s not much people in my contacts; I don’t have many friends. I didn’t want to call anyone on Nisa’s phone because, like, all her friends are younger than me, SHE’S younger than me, two years younger. If I had to guess, she just wanted to call people on my phone because they’re older than her, and she’d enjoy talking to someone else who’s older. She calls up Anna because I think she’d be fine with it. She was with someone because a guy picked up. Nisa asked who it was. He answered her boyfriend. Nisa hung up. That’s what turned me off. I don’t have a crush on her anymore. I also told her that, regardless of what was said, I supposedly “Didn’t like her like that, and never did.”

My crush really hurt me by leading me on which then brought me to finding the most amazing person I now call my girlfriend and hopefully to be fiancè. I was hella crushing on a girl in school so I asked her to “Prom”. She said “Yeah” and I thought a love was blooming. But she didn't feel the same, or she did but wasn't into monogamy. Point is, she was a very illusive on the tongue, a lover of white lies and had more strings on people than a puppeteer on his puppets. I was smitten and got dragged along for months until I had had enough. By that stage I had been reunited with old friends who she knew. One of these old friends was a incredibly funny and charming girl I had known from crawling and chewing on my toes years. Her name was katelyn. Someone I would walk to and from school with and a plethora of inside jokes with yet never had any feelings in anyway more than friends for. So I called of the debs partnership and cut ties which was very hard but was best. And my friend convinced me to ask Katelyn! Here how it went. “Katelyn (2nd name), would you do me the honor of going to Debs(Prom) with me?” she replied. “I would be honored” So she accepted! That was at the start of summer break, the next 4 months were spent growing closer and falling in love before I asked her out finally. She said “Noooooo” jokingly and then said I could call her mine. Since then we've moved in with each other, traveled the world, fallen in love and planned a future. Yeah I guess that's a plot twist if not, well sorry and have a good day!
